# Aufgabe

Importieren Sie den Datensatz `mariokart` in R.
Berechnen Sie den mittleren Verkaufspreis (`total_pr`) für Spiele, die sowohl neu sind *oder* über Lenkräder (`wheels`) verfügen.

Hinweise:

- Runden Sie auf 1 Dezimalstelle.



</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung

Pakete starten:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr4_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_04fe4fae37741972e6a87819c2127ea2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(easystats)
```
:::



Daten importieren:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr4_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_4bc8f990cd4a283821921253fa2d3a67'}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_url <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/openintro/mariokart.csv"
d <- data_read(d_url)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr4_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_9fac3fe585b1ce747d801a5c1e8e75bc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
solution <-
d  %>% 
  filter(cond == "new" | wheels > 0) %>% 
  summarise(pr_corr = cor(total_pr, start_pr))

solution
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
     pr_corr
1 0.04725486
```
:::
:::




Alternativ kann man (komfortabel) die Korrelation z.B. so berechnen:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr4_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_696ad4dc72d59d12c92fbf0aa992f965'}

```{.r .cell-code}
d %>% 
  select(start_pr, total_pr, cond, wheels) %>% 
  filter(cond == "new" | wheels > 0) %>% 
  correlation()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# Correlation Matrix (pearson-method)

Parameter1 | Parameter2 |    r |        95% CI | t(108) |       p
-----------------------------------------------------------------
start_pr   |   total_pr | 0.05 | [-0.14, 0.23] |   0.49 | 0.762  
start_pr   |     wheels | 0.08 | [-0.10, 0.27] |   0.88 | 0.762  
total_pr   |     wheels | 0.28 | [ 0.10, 0.45] |   3.09 | 0.008**

p-value adjustment method: Holm (1979)
Observations: 110
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr4_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_781f8d54a058aad294f4e0963c590279'}

:::


**Lösung:** 0.0.
